biography: Prolific author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, and fantasy novels. Known as the 'King of Horror' with over 60 novels and 200 short stories.
Author best known for the Harry Potter fantasy series, which has sold over 500 million copies worldwide. Also writes crime fiction under the pseudonym Robert Galbraith.
Author and screenwriter known for his epic fantasy series A Song of Ice and Fire, which was adapted into the HBO series Game of Thrones.
English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, which interpret, critique and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.
Contemporary Japanese writer known for his surreal and magical realist fiction. His works have been bestsellers in Japan and internationally.
Nigerian writer whose works include novels, short stories and nonfiction. Known for 'Purple Hibiscus', 'Half of a Yellow Sun', and 'Americanah'.
Nobel Prize-winning American novelist, short-story writer, and journalist. Known for his economical and understated style that influenced 20th-century fiction.
Colombian novelist, short-story writer, screenwriter and journalist. Nobel Prize winner known for popularizing magical realism with 'One Hundred Years of Solitude'.
Canadian poet, novelist, literary critic, and environmental activist. Best known for her dystopian novel 'The Handmaid's Tale' and its television adaptation.
American writer and professor of biochemistry, known for his works of science fiction and popular science. Wrote or edited over 500 books.
Nobel Prize and Pulitzer Prize-winning American novelist, editor, and professor. Her works are known for their epic themes, vivid dialogue, and richly detailed characters.
English writer, poet, philologist, and academic, best known as the author of the high fantasy works 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings'.
English writer known for her 66 detective novels and 14 short story collections, particularly those revolving around fictional detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.
English author of short fiction, novels, comic books, graphic novels, and audio theatre. His works include 'The Sandman' comic series and 'American Gods'.
English writer, considered one of the most important modernist 20th-century authors and a pioneer in the use of stream of consciousness as a narrative device.
